items.title: Say hello to the Central Park Zoo's three new bears
items.description: The bears, Amber, Luna, and Treena, come from the Bronx Zoo.

image.title: Central Park bears (Julie Larsen Maher)
image.alt: photographs of the brown bears debuting in Central Park
image.caption: The Central Park Zoo's new bears
image.credit: Julie Larsen Maher, Wildlife Conservation Society / Central Park Zoo

related_authors.biography:
Jen Chung co-created Gothamist in 2002 with Jake Dobkin, establishing it as a website about New York City and everything that happens in it and an essential must-read for New Yorkers. She also launched sites across the country and world, including DCist, LAist, and Londonist. She loves learning about NYC arcana and meeting bodega cats. 

She is currently Senior Editor of NYC Accountability in the Gothamist + WNYC newsroom.

items.title: Free rides to celebrate 100th birthday of Jane's Carousel
items.description: The carousel, which was restored by Jane Walentas and brought to Brooklyn in 2011, was originally built in 1922.

image.title: Jane's Carousel
image.alt: A photograph of a carousel with horses, with the East River seen on the right side
image.caption: Jane's Carousel

items.title: NYC Subway system’s history as a rare target of mass violence
items.description: The subway system has been the target of other violent attacks, most notably bombing attempts.

image.title: Increased security subway bag check (Shutterstock no reuse)
image.alt: Police officers check a passenger's bag
image.caption: The police check a subway rider's bag at a subway station

related_authors.biography: Sophia Chang is a reporter on the NYC Accountability desk covering government policy, social structures and other issues that enable and complicate city life.

Jaclyn writes data-driven health and science stories for WNYC/Gothamist. She also runs Gothamist's COVID data dashboards. She is an alumna of the Newmark Graduate School of Journalism. Her work has appeared in NBC News, Spectrum, the Daily Beast, and other outlets.

Jen Chung co-created Gothamist in 2002 with Jake Dobkin, establishing it as a website about New York City and everything that happens in it and an essential must-read for New Yorkers. She also launched sites across the country and world, including DCist, LAist, and Londonist. She loves learning about NYC arcana and meeting bodega cats. 

She is currently Senior Editor of NYC Accountability in the Gothamist + WNYC newsroom.

items.title: Car-Free Earth Day is coming back in 2022
items.description: 100 streets will be car-free on Saturday, April 23rd, which will kick-off 2022's Open Streets program.

image.title: Bicyclists Summer Streets (Scott Lynch)
image.alt: Dozens of bicyclists can be seen on Park Avenue during Summer Streets
image.caption: Bicyclists enjoying Summer Streets on Park Avenue

items.title: Coyote spotted wandering around Fort Tryon Park
items.description: "Over the last several decades coyotes have been expanding their natural range in response to ample food and open habitat," the Parks Department said.

image.title: Coyote (Robert Randall)
image.alt: A coyote in the woods with rocks in the background
image.caption: The coyote in Fort Tryon
image.credit: Courtesy of Travis Aikman and Robert Randall

items.title: Former MA transportation head Richard Davey to lead city transit
items.description: "Davey lives with his wife and two rescue cats and has not owned an automobile in 12 years," the MTA's press release said.

image.alt: Photograph of Richard Davey in a suit, gesturing
image.caption: Richard Davey

items.title: DOT to install 500 accessible pedestrian signals at intersections next year
items.description: A federal judge said that New York City too slow to make the city's streets accessible to the blind and low-vision pedestrians.

items.title: Jump in red-light violations in NYC renew push for local control of state traffic laws
items.description: Only a small fraction of NYC's streets have red-light cameras, which give tickets to speeders and prevent speeding.

image.title: School zone speed limit NYC (Jen Chung)
image.alt: a speed limit sign for 15 mph across the street from a school on a nyc street

items.title: NYC could lift indoor school mask mandate on March 7th
items.description: Statewide, Governor Hochul announced the indoor mask mandate for schools will be lifted on March 2nd. The city is waiting longer.

image.title: schoolguidepic.png
image.alt: A young girl wearing a red tshirt and a face mask gives the peace sign to the camera at PS 8 in Brooklyn.
image.caption: A student at PS 8 in Brooklyn.
